alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Central and South Weld County; Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North Douglas County Below 6000 Feet, Denver, West Adams and Arapahoe Counties, East Broomfield County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 6:43PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Weld, northeastern Elbert, Arapahoe, northeastern Denver and central Adams Counties through 730 PM MDT... At 641 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Denver International Airport to near Matheson, or along a line extending from 15 miles northeast of Denver to 19 miles southwest of Limon. Movement was north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. A wind gust to 56 mph was reported in southeast Aurora with these storms. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Northeastern Aurora, eastern Commerce City, Denver International Airport, D.I.A Terminal and Concourses, Lochbuie, Hudson, Bennett, Keenesburg, Deer Trail, Manila Village, Matheson, Agate, Strasburg, Watkins, Byers, Prospect Valley, and Cottonwood Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
